Welcome to Abernathy and enjoy your stay!

Our small, vibrant community of approximately 3,000 is filled with exuberant energy.

We have an excellent school system that excels in both academics and athletics. Our park and baseball fields provide great opportunities for leisure and recreational activities, while our local restaurants offer great southern meals. Whatever your fancy, we will do our very best to accommodate your valued needs!

Frequently Asked Questions

Do you have a question?

How many dumpsters are assigned to each house?

One dumpster assigned to every three (3) houses.

Who do I contact for Hale County citations given outside City Limits?

You would need to contact Karen Davis, Justice of the Peace for Precinct 3. Her contact number is (806) 757-2481 and office hours are 8:30 am – 5:00 pm / Monday – Friday.

What is the process for requesting a trailer?

The City of Abernathy has a limited number of trailers available to in-town utility customers for waste disposal. Trailer requests are handled in the order received and may take several days before one is delivered to your address.

To request a trailer, please complete the trailer request form on the Public Works webpage or contact City Hall at (806) 298-2546.

If you are unsure about what can be loaded onto trailers, please contact City Hall. Please note: Loose trash and leaves must be bagged.

Who do I contact about stray dogs and cats?

To check on a lost pet or report stray animals, please call (806) 298-2546 during regular business hours. For incidents that occur after-hours, please call or text (806) 801-2700.

How do I reserve City Hall’s Community Room for an event?

To reserve the City Hall’s Community Room, please contact (806) 298-2546. The deposit is currently set at $50 with a rental fee of $100.

What is the lunch hour period for the City’s Library?

The lunch schedule for the City’s library personnel is 1pm – 2pm. Donations are also accepted by the Library Director in order to foster the growth of all Library programs.

For more Library information, please visit the Library webpage.

Please be aware that on the early morning of Friday, February 6 from approximately 3:00am to 5:00am, all XCEL customers inside the city limits, will be without power as XCEL will be doing necessary updates and repairs to our main disconnect for our city.

Thank you for understanding and we apologize for any inconveniences this may cause. ... See MoreSee Less
